name: Onur Varol
about:
PI of the VRL Lab.
researcherüìä, coderüíª, dreamerüí≠
bio: Dr. Onur Varol is an Assistant Professor at the Sabanci University Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences and Principal Investigator at the VIRAL Lab. His research focuses on developing techniques to analyze online behaviors to improve individual well-being and address societal problems using online data. Prior to joining Sabanci University, he was a postdoctoral researcher at Northeastern University at the Center for Complex Network Research. He completed his PhD in Informatics at Indiana University, Bloomington (USA). His thesis focuses on the analysis of manipulation and threats on social media and he was awarded the 2018 University Distinguished Ph.D. Dissertation Award. He has developed a system called Botometer to detect social bots on Twitter and his team ranked top 3 worldwide at the 2015 DARPA Bot Detection Challenge. Efforts on studying social bots yield publications on prestigious venues such as International Conference of Web and Social Media (ICWSM), Nature Communications, World Wide Web (WWW) conference, and Communications of the ACM. He interned at Microsoft Research for two summers during his PhD to develop causal analysis of large-scale social media timelines. He is currently working on quantifying success of online personas and impact of their actions. He is also modeling user interactions, leveraging online data across multiple platforms to understand conscious and unconscious behaviors.
education: Ph.D. Informatics, Indiana University, 2017
M.Sc. Computer Science and Engineering, Koc University, 2012
B.Sc. Physics Engineering, Istanbul Technical University, 2012
B.Sc. Electronics Engineering, Istanbul Technical University, 2010

name: Ismail Ulut√ºrk
about: Interested in wireless, social, and gluten networks.
bio:
He is a recent PhD from University of South Florida, studying machine learning applications for technological and social networks. He is particularly interested in decentralized multi-agent cooperation and decision making. His current projects include collaborative trajectory control for a novel aerial Radio Access Network utilizing Reinforcement Learning, and studying the implications of the existence of social bots.
He also have 8 years of start-up industry research and development experience with a company developing healthcare RFID / IoT solutions where I joined as one of the first 10 employees, working on design and development of several products that are currently deployed in hospitals internationally throughout all stages of the product cycle.
education: PhD in Electrical Engineering, University of South Florida, 2020
MSEE in Electrical Engineering, University of South Florida, 2017
BSc in Electrical Engineering, Istanbul Technical University, 2012

name: Burak √ñzturan
about: Investigating the online behaviour of Turkish Members of Parliament
bio:
Burak Ozturan is a computational social science researcher. He is currently doing his MSc in Data Science at the University of Konstanz. He gained his Bachelor's degree in Economics from Bogazici University. His research interests are at the intersection between data science and social sciences. He is employing both social network analysis and computational text analysis methods to study disinformation and online polarization and public opinion.
He participated in the SICSS (Summer Institute in Computational Social Science) in 2020. He presented his Turkish Twittersphere during the COVID-19 pandemic research at ECPR (European Consortium for Political Research). He is also currently carrying out research with Dr. Onur Varol investigating the online behaviour of Turkish Members of Parliament and planning to compare with US Senate.
education: MSc in Data Science, Universit√§t Konstanz, 2020
BSc in Economics, Bogazici University, 2018

He worked as a Data Analyst in Finansbank as a management trainee and learned the real life applications of finance and data processing. He learned to gather and process the data using SQL and he had an opportunity to work with a simple anomaly detection project using Python in finance. His area of interests merge with those trending topics.

bio: Davut Bayƒ±k is a Data Science MSc student at Sabanci University. He graduated from the same university with an Industrial Engineering degree in 2020 June. He also has a minor degree in Finance. He conducted a summer internship at SabanciDx's SAP Support and Consultancy Department in summer 2019. After the internship, he joined SabanciDx as a part-time SAP Consultant when he was a senior student at Industrial Engineering, from between 2019 October ‚Äì 2020 July. During summer 2020, he started a second internship at Kariyer.net R&D Department. At Kariyer.net, he worked with Data Scientists on an ongoing recommendation systems project to design two types of recommendation systems: behavior-based recommendation system using collaborative filtering and content-based recommendation system using machine learning. At the end of my internship, these two systems are combined and become a hybrid recommendation system for Kariyer.net. Davut is broadly interested in deep learning and statistics.

name: Nihat Muƒüurtay

bio: Dr. Nihat Muƒüurtay has a Ph.D from Sabanci University, Political Science department. His doctoral dissertation focuses on China, Turkey, and the United Arab Emirates' global foreign aid behavior, explaining how geopolitical and economic factors shape non-traditional donors‚Äô response to OECD-DAC donors. He has taught International Political Economy at Sabancƒ± University. Apart from academics, Nihat has extensive research experience on youth radicalization and ethnic issues in Turkey and worked in different thinks-tanks as a consultant and researcher, including International Crisis Group and TESEV. Nihat joined Viral Lab as a post-doctoral researcher in August 2022, and desires to link international relations with computational methods.  Nihat employs quantitative methods in his research and aims to sharpen his methodological skills by adopting computational tools, including Web Scraping and social media analysis. He has advanced experience in STATA and Latex.

bio: Vahid Khalili Param is a Computer Science Ph.D. student at Sabanci University. He was involved in several projects with main focus on opinion dynamics and sentiment analysis on social media. He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Executive Management from Islamic Azad University, Science and Research Branch in Iran. His research interest is the emerging intersection of data analytics, social physics, and computational social science to study the dynamics of human collective behavior under the influence of the social digital interactions of individuals. Social innovation, civic engagement, and data-driven policy-making platforms are also his research interests as connecting dots to his future academic life. He was involved in a research project for a national call during a pandemic where he used social media content analysis, sentiment analysis, NLP, and other techniques to extract opinions and emotions from objective social media data. He has a professional background of social media strategist and growth hack mentoring for several companies and start-ups in Iran.

name: Yasemin Tosun
education: Ph.D. in Political Science, Sabancƒ± University, 2023

bio: Dr. Yasemin Tosun completed her Ph.D. in Political Science at Sabancƒ± University. Her dissertation focuses on the relationship between political representation and protest behavior and utilizes various statistical analyses with using the data from worldwide conducted surveys. She also has experience in designing and conducting experimental studies. Yasemin has an extensive knowledge of research methodology, gained through assisting courses ranging from quantitative research methods to formal modeling during her doctoral education. She obtained a TUBITAK pre-doctoral research grant, which allowed her to spend six months at the University of Texas at Austin studying with Professor Zeynep Somer-Top√ßu. Additionally, Yasemin was awarded the TUBITAK 1002 - Short Term R&D Funding to conduct a survey experiment as part of her dissertation. Yasemin joined Viral Lab as a post-doctoral researcher in September 2023, motivated to integrate computational tools into her studies. Her goal is to connect different data sources from representative surveys and social media to analyze political behavior. She has experience working with various software programs, namely STATA and R.

bio: Ai≈üe √ñzayt√ºrk is a master‚Äôs student in Data Science at Sabancƒ± University. She previously completed an MA in Comparative Studies in History and Society. Her thesis, titled "The Contemporary Changes in Subcontracting of Istanbul's Apparel Industry: An Analysis of Syrian Refugees; Bargaining Power in Global Capitalism" explores the apparel industry's embeddedness in global capitalism and the positioning of Syrian refugees in the final stages of global apparel chains. She is currently working in Dr. Yasemin Tosun‚Äôs T√úBƒ∞TAK 3501 Project, "Online Activism through Social Media: The Case of Turkey", as a computational social scientist.
